reviews.review_msg: Ben like all profs has his own opinions. However if your opinion differs from his, he does not like this and will grade you harder because of it. Alot of class time was wasted doing presentation.
High interest in the subject.

The great thing about his classes are that he keeps them flowing. At least POL 449 was based on presentations and discussion, keeping class awake. He also has a sense of humor. However, prof is a HARD marker, mark my words. He openly says some people lack intellectual capacity and he is not afraid to give low grades. Good class but VERY HARD.
He is awesome!! Take his class if you really want to learn.
One of the most brilliant and down to earth profs in Poli Sci, you will not regret taking a course with him.

His lectures were extremely entertaining, and quite helpful for prepping the MT and Final. Can't say the same about the texts assigned though. Overall, loved his classes and I would definitely take another class with him.
Awesome class!!!  Tough as nails though but well worth the effort!!!!
The comment below didn't work out. Muller is 5 across the board!
Muller is the best ever. No doubt. Slackers shut the hell up. Work and get it. Done.
I love Muller!  You get what you put in.  This guy is crazy awesome.
This guy is awesome, the best prof at SFU.  I got an A+, he is a fair marker.

if you plan on eventually getting a phd in polisci, this is your guy. if you're somewhat interested in the subject but just testing the waters, stay away from him. he's extremely interested in the subject and expects everyone else to share his same enthusiasm.
Tough readings, tough prof, but awesome overall

Ben's interest and passion is very evident in the subject of Security. He definitely has a very eclectic style of teaching. I thoroughly enjoyed his class and would definitely take another upper division course with him. I found him to be very personable and easy to approach. My grade for him is an A-. Take care Ben!

definitely a demanding prof - but i daresay that those people who don't like him don't have much to contribute to class anyways...he's a good professor - his job is not to babysit you, but rather to help you learn and critically think - i'd take him again without hesitation
Muller wasn't that bad. He handed out exam questions before exams, and his lectures were interesting and relevant. The TAs were great!
Thinks to much of himself. Does accept opinions that differ from his own. His choice in ta's in terrible. Worst pol sci prof in the department.
Interesting lectures, well organized, relevant assignments. Overall, the class was a good experience, but don't expect an A, he is a hard marker esp. on essays.
In my opinion, the toughest prof currently in the SFU Poli Sci department.  Not a class for slackers.  You better think critically and there's no room for half ass remarks.
Might be a bit crazy, but amazing material and approach to teaching that is not common - particularly in SFU POLI. And yes, rather hot...

Every Poli Sci student has to take this course; it should be a pre-req. Ben offers the type of education that only if you're lucky you will come across; the course material is unbelievably interesting and hard, but if you don't slack off he is a relatively easy marker.

Some people love Muller, some people dont. If you love Muller you must: spout political science theory even though you may not like it... In one presentation a student defended GWB... Muller rolled his eyes and crossed his arms... You have to hate Bush and believe that he is solely and personally responsible for the loss of freedoms in the US.

I am an engineering student but I took pol100 as elective and by far it has been the best class I ever had. Dr. Muller makes lectures so much fun, you find it hard to resist going to them. He is also alway well dressed and organized.
Lecture and reading materials are not explained. This course should be done by distance ed. Muller does not teach

Professor Muller is a really interesting.  His witty quips about various topics terrorism and the bush administration are hilarious.  His lectures are also engaging because he uses documentaries and current examples about the topic. And when he laughs about his own jokes, it's so cute.

I am in shock of some of the comments here about Ben. You say he is a reason for you to never take a POLISCI class again?! I am in my fifth class with him and he is by far the best prof I have ever had. The readings are ALWAYS relevant and engaging. He is open to other opinions and always encourages debate. Grades are not meant to be spoon fed.
Fantastic prof. knows what he is talking about, and he is passionate about what he teaches. Can't wait to take upper division courses with him.

Ben is an amazing prof for those who put in the effort. For those who are unprepared to actually work at post-secondary studies this may not be someone you would favor, but for those who are truly academically inclined he is an absolute delight and will engage you in a way that not many professors do. You either love him or hate him.

One of the worst profs I have had. His lectures do not match up with the assigned readings. The selection of readings that are assigned are poor. Maybe he is a good graduate prof, my he shouldn't be teaching an intro to pol sci class.

Uvic can have him back. He brings down the political science dept. at sfu, He's lectures are uncoordinated and he doesn't like views that differ from his own. Avoid any class with him. I know that there is a storage of people to teach poli sci classes but any student doing there MA or PHd would be better than him

This class was the worst Experience of my post secondary studies. With over 100 credits completed I have a few professors to compare against. Zero Prof-TA communication, obviously did not read course books before assigning them, lack of interest in material and students.  These are the sentiments of most in the class.  Do NOT take a class with Ben!
I don't know what you guys are talking about I'm from Uvic and we in the poli sci department would kill to have him back! Viva the Ben fan club!

great professor... very engaging and analytical.  Not for those who like to be spoonfed with cute overheads and powerpoint presentations, but more thematic and critical in his approach.  very helpful in office hours and cute too!  A bit challenging for 1st year, but suck it up.

Average prof. He might make a better upper division teacher but for 100 he was a bad choice. Lectures are totally unco-ordinated. He also expects us to replicate the textbook and lectures on tests/ papers and punished outside research, especially if it went against the political views he was cramming down our throat. TA's taught us everything.

Worst prof at Simon Fraser.  Brutal.  Makes me not want to take another Poli Sci Course.  Lectures are borderline lunacy--just brutal.  Marking is maniacle--even worse.  Do NOT take any lower level classes with this man.  I feel like I wasted my money.  I do not recall any of my classmates liking this prof--even those of us that enjoy Pol.

As said already, he'd be an awesome 300 and 400 level prof. Teaching POL 100 was a horrible decision on someone's part. This should be the most basic course available, and it consisteded of namedropping dead french philosophers. Interesting? Sure, yeah. But the expectation that a bunch of kids out of High School can survive this class is ludicrous.

Worst prof ever.  No structure to lessons, would make a good 300 or 400 level teacher but he teaches Pol 100 like a 300 level class.  Very very bad, I would never take another lower level course with him.
Awesome class; difficult readings; not good Prof for whiners.
Anal about making material available, Says hes not used to teaching 100 level courses, lectures are unrelated to examinable material, TA's have to teach us basically everything

Admittedly, I'll say I have a man-crush.  But, oddly, I left the class depressed for the world every time.  I think Iran is going to explode upon itself real soon because of this man.  Love the class.
The guy is deep.  I like him
Bad lectures, reading lists seemed to be unrelated to the class

Interesting lectures, but the classes are unstructured do to the fact that they are largely comprised of student presentations. If you want an entertaining class, take this class. If you want to boost or maintain your GPA, don't take a class with Muller

Not for the weak of heart (like the last two commentators I guess). If you're not willing to reimagine, and it might hurt, this is not for you. Not a question/answer, learn to throw the profs ideas back at him sort of class. Time to think for yourself.

He's fun, but he's ultimately a very difficult professor because he does not give structured lectures by any stretch of the imagination. As a result, you sort of have to stumble through your assignments hoping for the best, because its never clear what the "main themes" he's trying to get accross are. I literally have no notes from this class.

Very arrogant. He's one of these professors who doesn't "get" the concept that people can have different opinions than him. From his perspective, everyone is either correct, or "naive." His non-lecture lectures are an easy and often fun format, but I didn't feel like I was getting my money's worth at all. There's such a thing as TOO casual.
Young, hip, understanding, very analytical but intellectual, great debater, helpful, and funny
